summary: This document is an email chain from October 2020 among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel and contractors discussing the urgent preparation and transfer of a 1TB hard drive containing approximately 40,000 files (about 300GB) related to the Epstein/Maxwell investigation for upload to the Relativity database for discovery production. The emails detail logistical steps for bates stamping, confidentiality marking, and data export.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.role: U.S. Attorney's Office personnel seeking update
persons.context: Mentioned as someone looking for an update on the upload and production timeline of the Epstein/Maxwell materials.

events.title: Data copying for Relativity upload
events.description: Approximately 40,000 files (300GB) related to the Epstein investigation were being copied onto a hard drive to be sent to PAE for upload to the Relativity database for stamping and production.

events.title: Data loaded to Relativity for review
events.description: Documents from the production were bates stamped and made available in Relativity for review under specific volume links (SDNY_PROD008, SDNY_PROD009).

events.title: Urgent drive preparation for discovery
events.description: A series of urgent emails coordinating the preparation of a 1TB hard drive to send to vendor PAE to copy a large production of Epstein/Maxwell materials for discovery.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) was urgently preparing a 1TB hard drive containing approximately 40,000 files (300GB) of Epstein/Maxwell investigation materials for discovery production in October 2020.
The materials included 'Images Seized During Search' from the FBI case file, indicating they were evidence obtained via search warrant.
The production process involved bates stamping, applying confidential stamps, and uploading to the Relativity database for legal review.
A significant discrepancy was noted: a drive contained about 41,000 files, but only about 22,000 appeared in two productions, raising questions about non-imaged native files.
The email chain shows active case management and evidence processing in the Epstein/Maxwell investigation years after Epstein's death.
